section.title: Project object
section.paragraph: The project object represents an After Effects project. Attributes provide access to specific objects within the project, such as imported files or footage and compositions, and also to project settings such as the timecode base. Methods can import footage, create solids, compositions and folders, and save changes.

section.title: Project.activeItem
section.paragraph: The item that is currently active and is to be acted upon, or a null if no item is currently selected or if multiple items are selected.
Item object or null; read-only.

section.title: Project.bitsPerChannel
section.paragraph: The color depth of the current project, either 8, 16, or 32 bits.
Integer (8, 16, or 32 only); read/write.

section.title: Project.compensateForSceneReferredProfiles

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 16.0 (CC 2019)

section.paragraph: True if Compensate for Scene-referred Profiles should be enabled for this project; otherwise false.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: Project.dirty

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 17.5 (CC2020).

warning.paragraph: This method/property is officially undocumented and was found via research. The information here may be inaccurate, and this whole method/property may disappear or stop working some point. Please contribute if you have more information on it!

section.paragraph: True if the project has been modified from the last save; otherwise false.
“Dirty” projects will have an * in the project window title.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: Project.displayStartFrame
section.paragraph: An alternate way of setting the Frame Count menu setting in the Project Settings dialog box to 0 or 1, and is equivalent to using the FramesCountType.FC_START_0 or FramesCountType.FC_START_1 enumerated values for the framesCountType.
Integer (0 or 1); read/write.

section.title: Project.expressionEngine

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 16.0 (CC 2019)

section.paragraph: The Expressions Engine setting in the Project Settings dialog box, as a string. One of:
String; read/write.

section.title: Project.feetFramesFilmType
section.paragraph: The Use Feet + Frames menu setting in the Project Settings dialog box. Use this attribute instead of the old timecodeFilmType attribute.
A FeetFramesFilmType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: Project.file
section.paragraph: The Extendscript File object for the file containing the project that is currently open.
File object or null if project has not been saved; read-only.

section.title: Project.footageTimecodeDisplayStartType
section.paragraph: The Footage Start Time setting in the Project Settings dialog box, which is enabled when Timecode is selected as the time display style.
A FootageTimecodeDisplayStartType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: Project.framesCountType
section.paragraph: The Frame Count menu setting in the Project Settings dialog box.
A FramesCountType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

warning.paragraph: Setting this attribute to FramesCountType.FC_TIMECODE_CONVERSION resets the displayStartFrame attribute to 0.

section.title: Project.framesUseFeetFrames
section.paragraph: The Use Feet + Frames setting in the Project Settings dialog box. True if using Feet + Frames; false if using Frames.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: Project.gpuAccelType

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 13.8 (CC 2015.3)

section.paragraph: Get or set the current projects GPU Acceleration option. see app.availableGPUAccelTypes
A GpuAccelType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

literal_block.inline: // access via scripting to Project Settings -> Video Rendering and Effects -> Use
// check the current value and alert the user

section.title: Project.items
section.paragraph: All of the items in the project.
ItemCollection object; read-only.

section.title: Project.linearBlending
section.paragraph: True if linear blending should be used for this project; otherwise false.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: Project.linearizeWorkingSpace

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 16.0 (CC 2019)

section.paragraph: True if Linearize Working Space should be enabled for this project; otherwise false.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: Project.numItems
section.paragraph: The total number of items contained in the project, including folders and all types of footage.
Integer; read-only.

section.title: Project.renderQueue
section.paragraph: The renderqueue of the project.
RenderQueue object; read-only.

section.title: Project.revision
section.paragraph: The current revision of the project. Every user action increases the revision number. New project starts at revision 1.
Integer; the current revision version of the project; read-only.

section.title: Project.rootFolder
section.paragraph: The root folder containing the contents of the project; this is a virtual folder that contains all items in the Project panel, but not items contained inside other folders in the Project panel.
FolderItem object; read-only.

section.title: Project.selection
section.paragraph: All items selected in the Project panel, in the sort order shown in the Project panel.
Array of Item objects; read-only.

section.title: Project.timeDisplayType
section.paragraph: The time display style, corresponding to the Time Display Style section in the Project Settings dialog box.
A TimeDisplayType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: Project.toolType

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.0 (CC 2017)

section.paragraph: Get and sets the active tool in the Tools panel.
A ToolType enumerated value; read/write. One of:
The following sample code checks the current tool, and if it is not the Unified Camera Tool, sets the current tool to that:

literal_block.inline: // Check the current tool, then set it to Unified Camera Tool (UCT). // Assume a composition is selected in the project.
// Add a camera to the current comp. (Requirement for UCT)
// If the currently selected tool is not one of the camera tools, set it to UCT.

section.paragraph: The following sample code uses the new app.project.toolType attribute to create a 360-degrees composition (environment layer and camera) from a selected footage item or composition selected in the Project panel. This script a good starting point for building VR compositions from equirectangular footage:

literal_block.inline: // Create a 360 VR comp from a footage item or comp selected in the Project panel.
// Create a comp with the footage.
// Apply the CC Environment effect and create a camera.
"Select a single footage item or composition in the Project panel."

section.title: Project.transparencyGridThumbnails
section.paragraph: When true, thumbnail views use the transparency checkerboard pattern.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: Project.usedFonts

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects (Beta) 24.0 and subject to change while it remains in Beta.

section.paragraph: Returns an Array of Objects containing references to used fonts and the Text Layers on which they appear in the current Project. Each object is composed of font which is a Font object, and layerIDs which is an Array of IDs from Layer.id. See Project.layerByID() to retrieve the layers.
Array of Objects; read-only.

section.title: Project.workingGamma
section.paragraph: The current project’s working gamma value, either 2.2 or 2.4. Setting values other than 2.2 or 2.4 will cause a scripting error. Note that when the project’s color working space is set, the working gamma value is ignored by After Effects.
Number; read/write.

list_item.paragraph: To set the working gamma to 2.4 (Rec. 709): app.project.workingGamma = 2.4;
To get the current working gamma: var currentGamma = app.project.workingGamma;

section.title: Project.workingSpace
section.paragraph: A string which is the color profile description for the project’s color working space. To set the working space to None, set workingSpace to an empty string.
Use app.project.listColorProfiles() to return an array of available color profile descriptions that can be used to set the color working space.
String; read/write.

list_item.paragraph: To set the working space to Rec.709 Gamma 2.4: app.project.workingSpace = "Rec.709 Gamma 2.4";
To set the working space to None: app.project.workingSpace = "";
To get the current working space: var currentSpace = app.project.workingSpace;

section.title: Project.xmpPacket
section.paragraph: The project’s XMP metadata, stored as RDF (XML-based). For more information on XMP, see the JavaScript Tools Guide.
String; read/write.
The following example code accesses the XMP metadata of the current project, and modifies the Label project metadata field.

literal_block.inline: // load the XMPlibrary as an ExtendScript ExternalObject
//get the project's XMPmetadata // update the Label project metadata's value

section.title: Project.autoFixExpressions()
section.paragraph: Automatically replaces text found in broken expressions in the project, if the new text causes the expression to evaluate without errors.

entry.paragraph: The text to replace.
The new text.

section.paragraph: Nothing.

section.title: Project.close()
section.paragraph: Closes the project with the option of saving changes automatically, prompting the user to save changes or closing without saving changes.

entry.paragraph: Action to be performed on close. A CloseOptions enumerated value, one of:

list_item.paragraph: CloseOptions.PROMPT_TO_SAVE_CHANGES:Prompt for whether to save changes before close.

section.paragraph: Boolean. True on success. False if the file has not been previously saved, the user is prompted, and the user cancels the save.

section.title: Project.consolidateFootage()
section.paragraph: Consolidates all footage in the project. Same as the File > Consolidate All Footage command.
None.
Integer; the total number of footage items removed.

section.title: Project.importFile()
section.paragraph: Imports the file specified in the specified ImportOptions object, using the specified options. Same as the File > Import File command.
Creates and returns a new FootageItem object from the file, and adds it to the project’s items array.

entry.paragraph: An ImportOptions object specifying the file to import and the options for the operation.

section.paragraph: FootageItem object.

section.title: Project.importFileWithDialog()
section.paragraph: Shows an Import File dialog box. Same as the File > Import > File command.
Array of Item objects created during import; or null if the user cancels the dialog box.

section.title: Project.importPlaceholder()
section.paragraph: Creates and returns a new PlaceholderItem and adds it to the project’s items array. Same as the File > Import > Placeholder command.

entry.paragraph: A string containing the name of the placeholder.
The width of the placeholder in pixels, an integer in the range [4..30000].
The height of the placeholder in pixels, an integer in the range [4..30000].
The frame rate of the placeholder, a floating-point value in the range [1.0..99.0].
The duration of the placeholder in seconds, a floating-point value in the range [0.0..10800.0].

section.paragraph: PlaceholderItem object.

section.title: Project.item()
section.paragraph: Retrieves an item at a specified index position.

entry.paragraph: The index position of the item, an integer. The first item is at index 1.

section.paragraph: Item object.

section.title: Project.itemByID()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 13.0 (CC 2014)

section.paragraph: Retrieves an item by its Item ID

entry.paragraph: The ID of an item, an integer.

section.paragraph: Item object.

section.title: Project.layerByID()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 22.0 (2022)

section.paragraph: Instance method on Project which, when given a valid ID value, returns the Layer object in the Project with that given ID.

entry.paragraph: A non-negative integer representing the ID of the Layer to be retrieved from the Project.

section.paragraph: Layer object with the given ID if it exists on the project; otherwise null. Non-valid IDs will throw an exception stating that the input parameter is not an unsigned integer.

literal_block.inline: "You can get the Layer from the ID!"

section.title: Project.listColorProfiles()
section.paragraph: Returns an array of color profile descriptions that can be set as the project’s color working space.
None.
Array of strings.

section.title: Project.reduceProject()
section.paragraph: Removes all items from the project except those specified. Same as the File > Reduce Project command.

entry.paragraph: An array containing the Item objects that are to be kept.

section.paragraph: Integer; the total number of items removed.

section.title: Project.removeUnusedFootage()
section.paragraph: Removes unused footage from the project. Same as the File > Remove Unused Footage command.
None.
Integer; the total number of FootageItem objects removed.

section.title: Project.replaceFont()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects (Beta) 24.0 and subject to change while it remains in Beta.

section.paragraph: This function will replace all the usages of Font object fromFont with Font object toFont. fromFont and toFont may be the the same.

This operation is a complete and precise replacement, even on TextDocuments which have mixed styling, preserving the character range the fromFont was applied to. If the toFont does not contain glyphs for all the characters which were in us by fromFont then invalid glyphs may result. There is no way at the current time to detect or report this.

entry.paragraph: fromFont
A Font object to be replaced.
toFont
A Font object to replace it with.

section.paragraph: Boolean.

section.title: Project.save()
section.paragraph: Saves the project. The same as the File > Save or File > Save As command. If the project has never previously been saved and no file is specified, prompts the user for a location and file name.
Pass a File object to save a project to a new file without prompting.

entry.paragraph: Optional. An Extendscript File object for the file to save.

section.paragraph: None.

section.title: Project.saveWithDialog()
section.paragraph: Shows the Save dialog box. The user can name a file with a location and save the project, or click Cancel to exit the dialog box.
None.
Boolean; true if the project was saved.

section.title: Project.setDefaultImportFolder()
section.paragraph: Sets the folder that will be shown in the file import dialog. This location will be used as an override until setDefaultImportFolder() is called with no parameters, or until After Effects is quit.

entry.paragraph: Extendscript Folder object.

section.paragraph: Boolean; indicates if the operation was successful.
Any of the following will set the default import folder to C:/My Folder:
Note: if the path refers to an existing file and not a folder, the Folder function returns a File object instead of a Folder object, which will cause setDefaultImportFolder() to return false.
To set the default import folder to the current user’s desktop folder: app.project.setDefaultImportFolder(Folder.desktop);
To disable the default folder, call setDefaultImportFolder() with no parameters: app.project.setDefaultImportFolder();

section.title: Project.showWindow()
section.paragraph: Shows or hides the Project panel.

entry.paragraph: When true, show the Project panel. When false, hide the Project panel.

section.paragraph: Nothing.

section.title: Project.newTeamProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Creates a new team project.

entry.paragraph: Team project name, string value.
Optional. Team project description, string value.

section.paragraph: Boolean. True if the team project is successfully created, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.openTeamProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Opens a team project.

entry.paragraph: Team project name, string value.

section.paragraph: Boolean. True if the team project is successfully opened, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.shareTeamProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Shares the currently open team project.

entry.paragraph: Comment, string value. Optional.

section.paragraph: Boolean. True if the team project is successfully shared, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.syncTeamProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Syncs the currently open team project.
Boolean. True if the team project is successfully synced, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.closeTeamProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Closes a currently open team project.
Boolean. True if the team project is successfully closed, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.convertTeamProjectToProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Converts a team project to an After Effects project on a local disk.

entry.paragraph: File object for the local After Effects project. File extension should be either .aep or .aet (.aepx is not supported).

section.paragraph: Boolean. True if the team project is successfully converted, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.listTeamProjects()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Returns an array containing the name strings for all team projects available for the current user. Archived Team Projects are not included.
Array of strings.

section.title: Project.isTeamProjectOpen()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether specified team project is currently open.

entry.paragraph: Team project name, string value.

section.paragraph: Boolean. True if the specified team project is currently open, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.isAnyTeamProjectOpen()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether any team project is currently open.
Boolean. True if any team project is currently open, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.isTeamProjectEnabled()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether or not team project is enabled for After Effects. (This will almost always return true.)
Boolean. True if team project is currently enabled, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.isLoggedInToTeamProject()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether or not the client (After Effects) is currently logged into the team project server.
Boolean. True if the client (After Effects) is currently logged into the team projects server, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.isSyncCommandEnabled()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether or not the Sync command is enabled.
Boolean. True if the team projects Sync command is enabled, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.isShareCommandEnabled()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether or not the Share command is enabled.
Boolean. True if the team projects Share command is enabled, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.isResolveCommandEnabled()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Checks whether or not the Resolve command is enabled.
Boolean. True if the team projects Resolve command is enabled, false otherwise.

section.title: Project.resolveConflict()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 14.2 (CC 2017.1)

section.paragraph: Resolves a conflict between the open team project and the version on the team projects server, using the specified resolution method.

entry.paragraph: The type of conflict resolution to use. A ResolveType enumerated value, one of:

list_item.paragraph: ResolveType.ACCEPT_THEIRS: Take the shared version. The shared version replaces your version.
ResolveType.ACCEPT_YOURS: Keep your version of the project. The shared version is not taken.
ResolveType.ACCEPT_THEIRS_AND_COPY: Copy and rename your version, then take the shared version. The shared version replaces your original version

section.paragraph: Boolean. True if the resolution of the specified type was successful, false otherwise.
